change.item: This is the first version of the encoded finding aid.

did.head: Summary Information
did.unittitle: Archipelago Books mss.
did.abstract: The Archipelago Books mss., 1981-2010, consists of the papers of the firm, including correspondence with authors, translators and advertisers; typescripts and manuscripts of books published; proof copies; and dust-jackets.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Founded by Jill Schoolman, Archipelago Books is a not-for-profit press devoted to publishing excellent translations of classic and contemporary world literature. In its first five years, Archipelago published over forty-five books in nearly twenty languages.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Correspondence; II. Catalogs; III. Periodicals and Other Printed Materials; IV. Business Materials; V. Writings; VI. Additions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Archipelago Books mss., 1981-2010, consists of the papers of the firm, including correspondence with authors, translators and advertisers; typescripts and manuscripts of books published; proof copies; and dust-jackets.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Archipelago Books mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Mary Dunn and Craig Simpson.
